New Records: The Dodgers have set a record for the most walks in any four postseason games with 31 walks so far in the NLCS against the Mets.
This is a dubious record for the Mets, who have issued the most walks by one team over any four postseason games with 31 walks in NLCS Games 1-4.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a leadoff home run in the first inning.
Mookie Betts had four hits in the game.
Tommy Edman hit two run-scoring doubles.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers knew they would see some nibbling from Mets starter Jose Quintana, who picks around the strike zone with precision.
The Dodgers had a plan to not give in to the nibble.
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman, who rested his ailing right ankle and watched the Dodgers move to within one more victory of the World Series, commented on the team's patience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers have a record of four consecutive postseason games with at least seven walks.
Max Muncy's on-base streak is now at 12 consecutive plate appearances, matching Reggie Jacksonâ€™s postseason record.
Others: The Dodgers are one more good day away from the World Series.
Muncy commented on the team's bonding and focus.
